text.headline: Palazzo della Civiltà Italiana: A Contested Heritage
text.text: Exploring the contested cultural heritage of the Palazzo della Civiltà Italiana in Rome, from its origins in the Fascist era to its modern-day recontextualization

media.caption: The construction of the Palazzo della Civiltà Italiana

text.headline: Construction and Fascist Intentions
text.text: Initiated as a symbol of Fascist ideology, the Palazzo della Civiltà Italiana was designed to showcase the power and modernity of Mussolini's Italy

text.headline: Post-War Controversy
text.text: After the fall of the Fascist regime, the Palazzo's significance was questioned, embodying a complex legacy of architectural beauty and ideological burden

text.headline: Modern Reappropriation by Fendi
text.text: The luxury fashion brand Fendi moves its headquarters to the Palazzo, sparking debate over the commercial use of historically charged architecture

text.headline: Contemporary Perspectives
text.text: Current views on the Palazzo illustrate a spectrum of interpretations, from those who see it as a monument to be preserved to others who view it as a symbol of oppression to be critically re-evaluated
